9.81.text:
Mesoamerica is the name of good old
Mexico, as per the historians.

15.02.text:
200000 inhabitants alone get settled here
for the first time in this huge land mass.

21.19.text:
These indigenous tribes
were known as the Mayans

24.33.text:
who ruled the place for
more than 6 centuries.

27.54.text:
Since 280 CE to all until 900CE,
the rule belonged to the Mayans.

34.71.text: This age is called as the classical period.

40.60.text:
Clear trade routes were formed in the
demographics with each city having its

46.17.text:
own temple, pyramids, plazas, canals,
ball courts, palaces and so forth.

55.34.text:
One of the most important crops
that were cultivated locally

59.19.text:
among the so many other crops
is the squash and the beans.

63.28.text:
Food crop that belonged
to the Mayans was maize.

66.88.text:
Water dwelling serpents tried
almost three times to create the

70.71.text:
human beings but ended up in failure
for the first two attempts.

74.90.text:
Finally they succeeded
in creating the Mayans.

78.04.text: This is the myth of the Mayans.

82.76.text:
The Mayan Civilization is incomparable
to many other civilizations of the past.

87.89.text:
They had their own ball
courts, recreational

90.89.text:
activities, and the
sports clubs, too.

93.85.text:
Ollama is one of the
games that they played.

96.56.text:
As the rings were of different
sizes, the complexity of the game is

100.68.text:
higher when there are changes made
in the venues of Mesoamerica.

108.09.text:
Nobles belong to the top
of the social table.

110.87.text:
They had the power to call
the shots and get the

113.49.text:
lower segments involved
in what they want to be.

116.36.text:
Secret societies were in
operation to guide the

118.90.text:
people and govern their
activities all the while.

121.90.text:
The religion was given due priority and
led them towards other achievements.

129.68.text:
Craft populations, and the
artisans as well as the

132.93.text:
officials only led the
life of the middle class.

136.47.text:
Other than that the social set up
either had the working class or the

140.38.text:
third segments in excessive amounts
or the monarchies in the top.

144.46.text:
That led to the decline of the Mayans
as the bottom level men and women

148.40.text:
started to rebel against the minority
nobles in a short span of time.

155.49.text:
While there were more
theories that were not

157.93.text:
giving enough evidences
towards the declined

160.34.text:
of the Mayans, the real convincing theory
is the heavy pressure on the lower class.

165.26.text:
Hurricane could have been
a reason otherwise too.

168.57.text:
The Mayan empire did not
had the biggest of the

171.66.text:
solutions in hand to
face4 any kind of the

174.39.text:
catastrophic destructions
like the plague, flood,

177.58.text:
epidemics, draught, warfare,
famine and so forth.

181.16.text:
Finally the last of the
nomadic groups that

184.01.text:
unfiltered into the
Mesoamerica was the Aztecs.

187.47.text:
They beloved that they had
closer relations with GOD.

191.05.text:
They might have come from
Texas, or the present Oklahoma.

196.96.text:
As soon as they arrived in the
Mexico region, they gained enough

200.50.text:
reputation in the domicile as one
of the fittest group of warriors.

204.38.text:
While being admired for
their bravery, they were

207.25.text:
simultaneously hated for
their cruel acts too.

210.64.text:
These Aztecs were hired by
the local towns, though.

216.83.text: Coxcox is the leader from the other tribes.

220.02.text:
Coxcox means peasant or farmer
or the farmer’s leader.

224.99.text:
He started to hire the community
of Aztecs as mercenaries.

228.77.text:
As per the expectations of the coxcox the
Aztecs was doing the duty pretty well.

234.02.text: They never let their boss down.

236.20.text:
They were fiercely fighting against the
enemies and held due respect for Coxcox.

241.50.text: Culhua is the daughter of Coxcox.

244.27.text:
As a token of grated for winning
against the enemies the

247.83.text:
Aztecs were asking the hand of
codcox’s daughter, later on.

251.84.text:
It means culhua after marriage
will be taking the throne, and

255.90.text:
be the queen to be regarded with
high respect like a goddess.

260.43.text:
Sacrifice was made later on
by the Aztecs with culhua.

264.69.text:
That made coxcox to take
revenge of t Aztecs.

268.67.text:
He sent an army to make the Aztecs
get scattered here and there.

273.28.text:
Later, they got settled in the
banks of the lake Texcoco.

277.18.text:
This was chosen for the sole reason
that the Aztecs got a strange message.

281.93.text:
An omen appeared with the eagle
perched on a cactus plant.

285.79.text: The eagle had a serpent on its beak.

288.22.text:
Anyone can see the same to be drawn
in the coat of arms for Mexico.

292.86.text:
Anyone can see that in the
Mexican flag as well.

296.86.text: They called the place as Tenochtitlan.

304.01.text:
High priests and the royal emperors
ranked number one in the social set up.

309.15.text:
Military officials and the judges
were in the equivalent grade.

313.07.text:
Tax collectors had a place
in the creamy layer as well.

316.99.text:
Common tradition of eldest son
taking the responsibility

320.59.text:
to become a king is not there
in the Aztec communities.

324.47.text:
That is because there can be
as many wives for any king.

328.18.text:
Only a legitimate wife is
allowed per ruler while

330.96.text:
there can be even hundreds
of illegitimate wives.

333.94.text:
There are kings who had
more than 1000 wives too.

340.85.text:
Scholars and the real wise
people belonged to these groups.

345.05.text:
Only a few people were able to serve this
class as intellectual few in the society.

350.55.text:
Others formed the intermediate groups
and the lower order commoners.

358.43.text:
This segment ranked number two but
only meager in their populace.

363.20.text:
There were really skilled fighters,
jests and artisans in the community.

368.02.text: The number of commoners was more though.

373.27.text: 90% of the population is purely commoners.

376.94.text:
They were serving the same community
for the simple reason that they were

380.68.text:
able to get enough security from the
royals and the nobles only then.

384.80.text:
Taxes were mandatory to be
paid to the nobles regularly

387.74.text:
for the sake of protecting
the life of the commons.

393.49.text:
Salves had no rights or
hereditary assets or properties.

397.80.text: They are the lowest of the social set up.

400.35.text:
Yet the slaves were given the
liberty to marry any free person.

404.45.text:
Rich gamblers can actually
bet the slaves in any wage.

408.66.text:
Man power buying and selling was one of
the richest trades during those days

413.43.text:
not only line the Mesoamerica but also
in many other parts of the world.

418.22.text:
Human trafficking by the secret sanities
rally left to the downfall of biggest of

423.44.text:
the empires all over the world and the
Aztecs war not any exception to that fact.

432.40.text:
Cuauhtemo in the fifteenth century is one
of the great Aztec emperors (1520-21).

439.75.text:
He came to throne just
at the age of eighteen.

442.86.text:
Spaniard invasions were at its
peak at that point of time.

446.72.text: The capital was besieged by the Spaniards.

449.68.text:
Aztec treasure was the
target of the Spaniards.

452.69.text:
Aztec was captured while
crossing the lake Texcoco and

455.99.text:
tortured bad, to reveal the
secret of the treasure.

459.51.text:
There was not any treasure
left out as such.

462.64.text:
It was already taken to the
Honduras by that time.

466.14.text:
Benito Juarez of nineteenth century was
the key personality to fight against

470.58.text:
the French occupation and held the
presidential role for more than five terms.

475.48.text:
Miguel Hidalgo is a priest, who was
the key reason to start the war of

480.08.text:
independence and also successfully
executed the proceedings of the war.

485.30.text:
Emiliano Zapata Salazar was a
coolie of Indian and European

489.67.text:
races, who fought for land
as well as independence.

493.65.text:
Just being a small land holder he
fought bravely against the Diaz's land

498.30.text:
reforms and actively participated
in the revolutions of independence.

503.35.text:
The Zapatistas was
formed by him which is

506.03.text:
mainly poor peasants
association that wished to

509.05.text:
spend most of their efforts and time towards
working their land and produce an income.

515.51.text: Benito Juarez suggestions for world peace

518.63.text:
Bringing in big economic reforms or doing
some kind of magic in the minds of worst

523.17.text:
politicians is not the need of the hour
to make the word a better place to live.

527.88.text:
It is anyone that has
to change in the first

530.33.text:
place for the effective
changes to fall in line.

533.50.text:
Every one of anyone should
bring in the changes in

536.80.text:
you, for the world to
become a paradise in fact.

540.26.text:
Some of the qualities that are to
be inculcated without fail in order

544.15.text:
to achieve the objective without
any big strain are listed below.

548.46.text: •Do not worry too much for anything

550.51.text: •Smile as much as you can and when possible

556.34.text:
•Challenging the fears
of yours is paramount

574.55.text:
How many of us are doing all
of these things already?

577.84.text:
Just imagine about mother Teresa and
her noble services for a moment.

582.13.text:
If not, imagine so many
such selfless leaders

585.19.text:
of the world that anyone
is inspired about.

588.37.text:
If not to that extent,
just try to follow the

591.17.text:
above list of things to
be accomplished in you.

594.38.text:
Anyone change anyone and
world changes on the

597.28.text:
whole, when every
individual does the same.

604.17.text:
Inequality existing in the society is
the basic root cause to the issues.

608.81.text:
Selfishness and avarice has led
the human society to the present

612.64.text:
miserable plight to be in the
verge of a third world war.

616.45.text:
People should awake at
this very right moment.

619.48.text:
Change could be brought
in imminently when

622.08.text:
everyone becomes aware of
the simple fact that man

625.11.text:
is a social animal and
he has to live in groups

627.98.text:
for him to last longer
without extinction.

631.09.text:
Moreover, one cannot sustain in this material
world in too much luxury for a prolonged

636.34.text:
period of time, even under ideal conditions
of financial security and safety,

641.02.text:
as his own physical structure will not
permit it over a period of time though.

646.16.text: There is a breaking stress for tolerance.

652.94.text:
Benito Juarez believed in the insanity
of the commons as inevitable.

657.76.text:
Security and safety is the prime
duty of the overruling parties.

662.05.text:
Ignorance prevails among majority
of the communities far and wide.

667.01.text:
People should be enlightened and
taught about the practical facts

670.76.text:
about social life as well as
individual or personal life too.

674.78.text:
Education and knowledge
of the real kind can only

678.12.text:
bring in effective changes
in the minds of all.

681.79.text:
When anyone follows the list mentioned above
anyone is developing into an individual

686.64.text:
that is ready to create a paradise in the
earth for everyone to rejoice together.

691.64.text:
When anyone ideally realizes that then
it is not an arduous task to accomplish.

697.38.text:
It is in fact and
interesting way of spending

700.16.text:
your life with a definite
purpose added on to it.

703.37.text:
It makes your existence
complete and it is a soul’s

706.34.text:
satisfaction which could keep
anyone happier all the time.

710.39.text:
Money alone cannot yield happiness by
any means, and people should start

715.09.text:
to realize these fundamental aspects
of life and act accordingly.

724.35.text:
Benito Juarez and his men
used the port of Veracruz

727.40.text:
towards developing the
international trade relations.

730.81.text:
New weapons were brought into the
Mexican domicile through the ports.

734.97.text:
There are important
landmarks in and around.

738.32.text:
Transportation facilities were channelized
further in land promoting trade relations.

744.54.text: Today the place is a hot spot.

747.15.text:
Veracruz rentals properties
are of a wide range.

750.65.text:
Depending upon the tastes of the tourist
guests and the budget constraints,

754.92.text:
a wide range of properties could be
located all around this locality.

759.38.text:
When there is higher comfort levels,
the costs are equally higher as well.

764.05.text:
The amount of money paid
towards the lease could vary

767.13.text:
significantly from one
property to that of the other.

770.55.text:
It depends a lot upon the
particular area and locality.

774.68.text:
Generally speaking most of the Veracruz
rentals properties out here are

779.05.text:
quite convenient and comfortable for a
family to dwell for weeks together.

784.06.text:
One can enjoy the wonderful
climatic conditions

786.69.text:
and the natural
beauty of the place.

788.89.text:
It is for these two reasons most
visitors find it comfortable

792.33.text:
to visit this part of the
world quite repeatedly.

795.39.text:
There are guests that lease the
properties for months together.

799.63.text:
Veracruz rentals are chosen to be the
best choices for corporate rewards.

804.03.text:
Companies lease some of these
properties and do allow

807.26.text:
their guests to enjoy the
occasion to the best.

810.62.text:
Business managers on successful
completion of noteworthy tasks are

814.98.text:
awarded with such fabulous gifts of
free stay in this exotic location.

820.45.text: Winners and Losers in Illegal Immigration

824.80.text:
People from Honduras and
Haiti kept coming in seeing

828.06.text:
the huge potential in Mexico
since centuries before.

831.57.text:
There were not any stringent
measures during those

834.45.text:
days to identify the
potential infiltrates.

837.27.text:
They found homes easily to get settled
in and around the Mexican ports.

842.31.text:
Veracruz rentals are available for daily,
weekly as well as monthly rents too.

848.17.text:
When a person takes a villa
or a guest house for a

850.89.text:
monthly rent, then there
will be a lot of advantage.

853.88.text: The costs would be far lower in that way.

856.83.text:
If it is just for a day or
two, then it would be at least

860.02.text:
10 to 20 percent of the
charges for the whole month.

863.31.text:
Weekly rents might be a
bit reasonable though.

866.44.text:
Booking in advance for your
Veracruz rentals is a great idea.

870.62.text:
When anyone is planning to move to
this locality for the next season,

874.45.text:
then it is intelligent to get your
bookings done well in advance.

878.22.text:
Either it be the lodging or
even the flight tickets,

881.04.text:
there is a lot of advantage
while booking in advance.

884.25.text:
Enormous amount of costs
could be minimized.

887.53.text:
Moreover, during season time,
getting a vacant room is

891.20.text:
quite difficult even in the
cottages of lesser costs.

894.91.text:
It is such a place of
extravagant luxury and

897.76.text:
extremely nice and romantic
climatic conditions.

901.73.text:
Young couples love to spend
their honeymoon in places

904.95.text:
like this in all privacy
to enjoy to the core.

908.12.text:
The night life in some of the resorts out
here by the bay region is splendid and

913.69.text:
people repeatedly do visit these places
as and when they get time to spend.

919.19.text:
Most of the properties will have a swimming
pool, heater, air conditioner and so on.

928.39.text:
From Columbia, Honduras and Haiti or
Porto Rico, narco trafficking to Mexico

934.31.text:
and in turn to USA is not just recent
but dates back to centuries now.

940.07.text:
The measures to counter
trafficking are there by the

943.19.text:
local governments but still
there is not full curb.

946.54.text:
Catastrophes lead to disaster on
the other side quite regularly.

951.31.text:
In case of any hurricane expected
during the booked days of journey,

954.80.text:
the whole of the money is
completely refunded to the guests.

958.16.text:
During hurricane, whole of the
island is completely evacuated.

962.74.text:
Still, if the forecasted landfall
of the hurricane is in this

966.70.text:
particular locality, then only
refunds could be expected.

970.86.text:
It is not for all those hurricanes that
pass away through the gulf of Mexico.

975.51.text:
Reservations could be made
to the paradise island

978.58.text:
villas and guest houses or
resorts over phone itself.

982.24.text:
Most of the properties have their own
websites and all the contact details

986.48.text:
and procedures of booking could be
found from the respective web pages.

990.87.text:
There are possibilities of
online booking as well.

993.82.text:
Most of the current reservations
are being done online

996.99.text:
due to the extreme ease
and comfort in doing so.

1002.27.text:
Usually, it is customary for
the owners here to charge

1004.51.text:
a night rent as advance in
order to hold the property.

1007.04.text:
It is just similar to
blocking tickets for a movie

1009.96.text:
or a train by paying
some money in advance.

1012.69.text:
The money will be deducted
while checking in.

1015.34.text:
If the booking is cancelled, part of
the money or none will be refunded.

1019.84.text: The rules vary from one place to the other.

1023.10.text:
Usually, if the cancellation
is done well ahead

1025.82.text:
of a month, then the
refund could be expected.

1028.73.text:
In case of very large resorts,
it could be even 60 days period.

1033.05.text:
Having said that one can understand
how earlier the bookings has

1036.50.text:
to be done to get the favorite
choices of villas and rooms.

1040.04.text:
It is important to inquire
about the number of

1042.30.text:
people that are possibly
allowed to stay in a villa.

1045.27.text:
Every house is usually enlisted with the
maximum number of people permitted.

1049.74.text:
Usually, every duplex room is
allotted to a couple of persons.

1054.47.text:
4 persons could possibly
sleep in double Bunk beds.

1058.14.text:
The maximum occupancy
in a property is

1060.29.text:
strictly monitored and
governed by the owners.

1063.14.text:
Most of the villa owners
insist the customers to

1065.83.text:
pay as Security deposits
that are refundable.

1068.67.text:
The terms and conditions related to this
particular payment are given in detailed

1072.99.text:
in the bill as well as prospectus that
are issued at the time of booking.

1077.25.text:
If there is any damage or repair
caused to the belongings of the house

1080.98.text:
then there will be deduction done
from the security deposit amount.

1085.26.text:
The management staff will
thoroughly inspect the whole

1087.76.text:
of the property just after
the check out is done.

1090.37.text:
Any malfunctioning of air conditioner,
heater, television, micro oven

1094.64.text:
or any other equipments and devices
will be reported to the owner.

1099.12.text:
It is essential to deal
with everything carefully.

1102.32.text:
In case of willing to bring
pets of different kind,

1105.27.text:
then suitable properties
should alone be selected.

1108.57.text:
Pet friendly villas are
separately available.

1111.58.text:
There will be nominal charges
for the pets that are brought.

1114.79.text:
It could vary from somewhere
between 30 to 150 dollars per pet.

1119.22.text:
Again it depends upon the standards of the
guest house that one chooses to book.

1123.84.text:
Life in Veracruz rentals is
lavish and dearer as well.

1128.02.text:
Most of the guests do
no mind the extravagant

1130.92.text:
cost of living as it is
a sojourn for comfort.

1134.05.text: Prices vary by far from season to season.

1137.20.text:
There are villas where anyone can
find more than a couple of price

1140.71.text:
lists for the same rooms during
different periods of a year.

1144.55.text: The Porfiriato and the regime of Diaz

1149.76.text: President had the big power in his hands.

1152.71.text:
It was the revolutions that united
the people of Mexico to protest

1156.52.text:
against the monarchs and get
liberty as one unit together.

1160.24.text:
When they united, the enemies had no other
choices but to fly away from the country.

1165.35.text:
Both the French and
the Spanish colonies

1167.73.text:
disappeared in no time
after the revolution.

1174.23.text:
Some Positives of the
Porfiriato are the artisans.

1178.23.text:
Handy crafts were superior and so
does the handmade Mexican hats.

1183.47.text: Cowboy hats from Mexico were world famous.

1186.53.text:
Quality is superior and
incomparable in standards.

1190.21.text:
European clients for the
cowboy hats from Mexico

1193.57.text:
and the Texas region of the
USA are on hot demand.

1197.31.text:
Yet, the original Mexican
hats were of more value.

1200.61.text:
Even to major other parts of Americas,
the Mexican hats were exported.

1205.93.text:
Mexican style Hats are worn both for
protection as well as style too.

1210.87.text:
Whatever might be the purpose
of using a hat on our head,

1213.92.text:
anyone will always have to
maintain it clean and tidy enough.

1217.50.text:
An unclean hat is of no good looks
and also can cause potential

1221.51.text:
health hazards like skin irritation,
nausea or headache, etc.,

1225.55.text:
so in order to keep it always look
new and good anyone need to maintain

1229.82.text:
them properly with certain hats
accessories specially made for hat care.

1234.39.text:
Let us see in detail about
these hats accessories below.

1238.14.text:
There are specially made cushion available
in the market for cleaning the felt hats.

1243.03.text:
Anyone can ask it as felt hat
cushion from the hatter.

1247.48.text:
These are for dry brushing
your hats on a daily

1250.31.text:
basis so that they do
look as new as ever.

1253.25.text:
A lot of things get
clanged on to the hat

1255.58.text:
fabric when anyone travels
a lot wearing that.

1258.39.text:
All the dust and dirt from the surface
of the felt hat inclusive of even

1262.48.text:
oily substance are cleanly nipped
off with the help of this cushion.

1269.97.text:
Only two types of hats
are in need of this

1272.64.text:
rain and stain cover hat
accessory basically.

1275.88.text:
A number of ordinary hats does
lose color and gets faded

1279.21.text:
away eventually after their
usage for a year or a couple.

1282.96.text:
Rain and stain cover is not suitable
to work in this category of the hats.

1287.33.text:
When anyone uses it on these
without knowledge the

1290.08.text:
color would fade away much
faster than the normal.

1292.98.text:
So when anyone is going
to use this cover on

1295.74.text:
your hat anyone need to
do a small sample test.

1299.20.text:
Take a minute quantity of the rain and stain
cover in a brush and just rub it on the

1304.08.text:
inner side of the hats in some remote
corner to find out if anyone loses color.

1309.10.text:
If the color of hat sticks on to the brush
do not use the rain and stain cover.

1313.96.text:
This could be identified when
anyone dip the brush in a

1317.11.text:
two three drops of water to
notice the color instantly.

1320.75.text:
If anyone cannot see any color
dispersion then it is good

1324.00.text:
to be used in your hat as an
effective water proof agent.

1330.68.text:
USA and the Mexico just like
the Canada and USA had some

1334.32.text:
pacts and agreements in between,
since way long time now.

1338.30.text:
Just like how the Niagara borders are
discreet between the two countries.

1343.15.text:
Huatulco bay is exclusive rights
of the Mexicans, even after

1346.64.text:
the success of the Americans
in the Wars fought since then.

1351.47.text:
Huatulco bay - paradise
